intro: Tournefortiopsis minor, commonly known as the small tournefortiopsis, is a rare and small flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe, particularly in Spain and France. The plant features delicate, compound leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
